intro: Nothocalais, commonly known as the "false kalanchoe," is a genus of flowering plants in the family Crassulaceae. It is native to South Africa and consists of several species that are characterized by their succulent leaves and showy flowers. The plants typically grow in rocky or arid environments, showcasing their adaptability to harsh conditions. Nothocalais species are often used in horticulture for their ornamental value and ease of cultivation. They are also known for their ability to propagate through offsets, making them popular among plant enthusiasts.
